Module menu.py¶

This module contains the class that abstrain a menu. This class have a lot of utility functions to handle buttons and their events.

class src.menu.Menu(screen)¶

Contains functions that create the menu and handle user interaction.

Parameters:

screen (pygame.display) – Screen shown to the player

config_menu(click)¶

Renders text prompts for selecting difficulty levels and handle user user interaction.

Parameters:

click (bool) – Indicates whether a mouse click event occurred.

Return type:

None

handle_config_menu_events(click)¶

Process user input during the configuration menu phase.

Parameters:

click (bool) – Indicates whether a mouse click event occurred.

Return type:

None

handle_quit_event()¶

Closes the window in case the player presses quit.

Return type:

None

handle_titlescreen_events(click)¶

Process user input during the title screen phase.

Parameters:

click (bool) – Indicates whether a mouse click event occurred.

Return type:

None

titlescreen(click)¶

Display the title screen elements and handle user interaction.

Parameters:

click (bool) – Indicates whether a mouse click event occurred.

Return type:

None

update(click=False)¶

Update the game state based on the current screen phase.

Parameters:

click (Optional(bool)) – Indicates whether a mouse click event occurred. Defaults to False.

Return type:

None
